function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"In-person teaching conferences, morbidity and mortality conferences, and simulation labs are being avoided due to the COVID-19 pandemic, leading to a decrease in resident case volume.","Impact":"Decreased in-person exposure to surgical education, affecting the learning experience of surgical trainees.","Mitigation":"Implementing innovative techniques and technologies to provide high-quality surgical education in a virtual or remote setting.","Technologies":"Virtual meeting platforms, simulation software, and online learning modules.","People":"Surgical trainees, educators, and patients.","Owner":"Educators, medical institutions, and healthcare organizations."},{"Description":"Rotations between different sites within the same institution should be limited or canceled to reduce the risk to residents, patients, and healthcare personnel.","Impact":"Reduced exposure to diverse medical settings, potentially affecting the learning and skill development of residents.","Mitigation":"Implementing virtual rotations, telemedicine training, and remote learning experiences to provide exposure to different medical situations.","Technologies":"Telemedicine platforms, virtual reality simulations, and remote communication tools.","People":"Residents, patients, and healthcare personnel.","Owner":"Medical institutions, residency program directors, and healthcare educators."},{"Description":"The American College of Surgeons and government institutions recommending against the continuation of elective surgery, with most facilities minimizing participants in any operation to essential personnel only.","Impact":"Decreased opportunities for surgical trainees to participate in elective surgeries and surgical procedures.","Mitigation":"Integrating virtual observation and tele-surgical experiences, conducting case-based discussions, and providing online resources for learning surgical procedures.","Technologies":"Live-streaming surgical procedures, virtual observation platforms, and online surgical training modules.","People":"Surgical trainees, surgical teams, and patients.","Owner":"Surgical educators, medical institutions, and healthcare organizations."}]}
